terms.definition: The 'server-side' of a website, responsible for database management and logic, often utilizing PHP.
terms.example: The backend handles all the database operations.

terms.definition: The 'client-side' part of a website that users interact with directly, including layout, design, and user experience.
terms.example: The frontend was built using React and Tailwind CSS.

terms.definition: (Application Programming Interface) A set of rules that allows two pieces of software to communicate with each other.
terms.example: The mobile app uses an API to fetch data from the server.

terms.definition: An API that follows REST (Representational State Transfer) principles for communication between client and server.
terms.example: Our app consumes a REST API to retrieve product data.

terms.definition: A lightweight data-interchange format that is easy for humans to read and for machines to parse.
terms.example: The API response was returned in JSON format.

terms.definition: A widely used, open-source relational database management system (RDBMS).
terms.translation: Sistema de gestión de bases de datos relacional
terms.example: Our application stores user data in a MySQL database.

terms.definition: A type of database that stores data in non-relational formats like documents or key-value pairs.
terms.example: MongoDB is a popular NoSQL database used in MERN applications.

terms.definition: A reusable piece of UI that can be combined with others to build complex interfaces.
terms.example: Each button in the app is a separate React component.

terms.definition: A pre-built structure that provides tools and libraries to speed up software development.
terms.example: Next.js is a popular framework for building React applications.

terms.definition: Software that acts as a bridge between the operating system and applications, or between different layers of an app.
terms.example: Authentication middleware checks if a user is logged in before accessing routes.

terms.definition: The process of identifying, analyzing, and removing errors (bugs) from computer hardware or software.
terms.example: I spent all night debugging the payment processing code.

terms.definition: Git is a version control system; GitHub is a platform used to host and collaborate on Git repositories.
terms.translation: Sistema de control de versiones / Plataforma de alojamiento de código
terms.example: We use GitHub to manage our project's source code and track issues.

terms.definition: A separate line of development in Git that allows you to work on features without affecting the main codebase.
terms.example: Create a new branch for each feature you develop.

terms.definition: Combining changes from one branch into another in a version control system.
terms.example: We merged the feature branch into the main branch.

terms.definition: The visible area of a web page on a device, crucial for Responsive Web Design.
terms.example: The viewport meta tag controls the layout on mobile devices.

terms.definition: An approach to web design that ensures web pages render well on various devices and screen sizes.
terms.example: Responsive design improves the user experience on mobile devices.

terms.definition: A CSS layout system that provides a powerful way to arrange elements in rows and columns.
terms.example: We used CSS Grid to align items perfectly in the layout.

terms.definition: The process of moving an application from a local environment to a live server or production environment.
terms.example: The new version of the app was deployed on Vercel.

terms.definition: A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications inside lightweight containers.
terms.example: We use Docker to ensure consistent environments across machines.

terms.definition: A lightweight, standalone package that includes everything needed to run a piece of software.
terms.example: Each microservice runs in its own container.

terms.definition: An open-source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.
terms.example: Kubernetes manages our containerized applications efficiently.

terms.definition: Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment; a method to automate testing and deployment processes.
terms.example: We use GitHub Actions for our CI/CD pipeline.

terms.definition: Amazon Web Services; a comprehensive cloud platform offering computing, storage, and networking services.
terms.example: The app’s backend is hosted on AWS EC2.

terms.definition: The delivery of computing services over the internet instead of local servers or personal devices.
terms.example: Cloud computing allows scalability and cost efficiency.

terms.definition: A cloud computing model where the cloud provider dynamically manages server allocation.
terms.example: We use serverless functions for lightweight API endpoints.
